Articles.Content:
Just completed my first orbital rendezvous and crew change. Must admit alot harder than it sounds and looks!

Heres some pics:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32340[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32341[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32342[/ATTACH]

Wasnt to sure how to do the spoiler thing

Gratz. It is tricky even for myself and ive done maybe a dozen meets.

Good work.
Very nice! Did my first few yesterday as well. Looks like you'll be dancing around the next rendezvous in no time.
i haven't done a rondezvous yet but only a few minutes ago i did my first munar landing ever
Nice, I have tried docking before but I failed horribly.
Nice I completed my first stock docking with lander legs not to long ago, and I've got rendevous down to a pretty easy routine myself
Well done. I can only get my rockets to touch eachother because when ever i try docking the actual spac estation starts tilting before im close enough for me to dock.
I think ive got rendezvous down. I even did my first rescue mission with the use of landing legs to de-orbit a capsule.

I've done a few rendezvous, too. My first one was kind of hard, since I had a Kerbal in Minmus orbit with 20% fuel, and had to guide him to the rescue ship (I'm putting more ladders on next time) so that he could grab on, still have fuel left, and not go so fast that he explodes on impact.
-,- i almost envy some of you guys that make it sound easy because i either have had the 2 ships colide or they are KMs apart, could i get some tips on how to do it?
Congrats, that's something I'll add to my to-do list!
